snippet: Some want to apply the model of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act court, which reviews eavesdropping on American soil, to the targeted killings of terrorism suspects.
abstract: News analysis; there is a growing interest in applying the model of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act, which requires eavesdropping on American soil to be reviewed by a federal judge, to the targeted killing of terrorism suspects; many Americans are uneasy that a president can use secret evidence to label a citizen a terrorist and order an execution without a trial or judicial ruling.
lead_paragraph: Some want to apply the model of the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act court, which reviews eavesdropping on American soil, to the targeted killings of terrorism suspects.

headline.main: Debating a Court to Vet Drone Strikes
headline.print_headline: A Court to Vet Kill Lists

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
